poem:
Title: On Silver Screens and Frayed Bonds

Seen,
in Sundance's weary stride,
the Son,
lost and found - a drama's tide.
Forgiveness, not anew, but never shown,
In earnest frames, a seed is sown.
Kaphar wields the brush, the vision true,
A reunion onscreen, burdens eschew,
Not revolution, but whispered confession,
In tales of strain, we find progression.
